<doc> Notepad widget

== Description ==

These markups implement //Notepads// in HOP documents. A //notepad// 
is a container. It is built using the ++<NOTEPAD>++ constructor. A
//notepad// contains a header (++<NPHEAD>++) and one or
several pads (++<NPTAB>++). Each //pad// contains a header (++<NPTABHEAD>++)
which is always visible and a body. The body is only visible when
the pad is selected. Only one pad is selected at a time.


~~ Note: ,(<SPAN> :style { font-weight: bold; color: red } [
The markups presented in this page are not yet supported on
client side programming. They are only supported on server side.])

== Synopsis ==

=== Server ===

  (<NOTEPAD> arg ...)
  (<NPHEAD> arg ...)
  (<NPTAB> arg ...)
  (<NPTABHEAD> arg ...)

=== Client ===
  
  (notepad-select notepad pad)

=== Requirements ===

Client codes using //Notepads// need to load the script ++hop-notepad.js++.
They also need to load the ++hop-notepad.css++ style sheet. Hence, documents
using //Notepads// must include in their header, the following statement:


  (<HEAD> :jscript "hop-notepad.js" :css "hop-notepad.css")


== Examples ==

<example><NOTEPAD></example>

== Server Definitions ==
<server>

=== ++<NOTEPAD>++ ===
<markup> <NOTEPAD>

<arguments>
^  attributes  ^   type    ^   default    ^  short description          ^
| :id          |  string   |  //random//  | element identifier.         |
| :inline      |  boolean  |   ++#t++     | inline or on-demand?        |
| body         |  element  |  empty       | the body.                   |
</arguments>

This function creates a //notepad//. Its first child can be 
++<NPHEAD>++. Its others children are all ++<NPTAB>++.
,(<P>)
A //notepad// may be //inlined// or //on-demand//. Clients received all
the bodies of a inlined notepad at a time. That is, the unselected tab's body
are present in the client. The pad's body of on-demand //notepad// are sent
to the client only when the pad is selected. Tabs body of on-demand 
//notepad// must use the ++<DELAY>++ markup.

</markup>

=== ++<NPHEAD>++ ===
<markup> <NPHEAD>

<arguments>
^  attributes  ^   type    ^   default    ^  short description          ^
| :id          |  string   |  //random//  | element identifier.         |
| body         |  element  |  empty       | the body.                   |
</arguments>

This function creates an optional //notepad// header.
</markup>

=== ++<NPTAB>++ ===
<markup> <NPTAB>

<arguments>
^  attributes  ^   type    ^   default    ^  short description          ^
| :id          |  string   |  //random//  | element identifier.         |
| body         |  element  |  empty       | the body.                   |
</arguments>

This function creates a //tab//. The first child of //tab// __must__
be a ++<NPTABHEAD>++.

</markup>

=== ++<NPTABHEAD>++ ===
<markup> <NPTABHEAD>

<arguments>
^  attributes  ^   type    ^   default    ^  short description          ^
| :id          |  string   |  //random//  | element identifier.         |
| body         |  element  |  empty       | the body.                   |
</arguments>

Creates a tab header.

</markup>
</server>

== Client Definitions ==
<client>

=== ++(notepad-select notepad tab)++ ===
<procedure> notepad-select

<arguments>
^  arguments  ^   type               ^  short description  ^
| notepad     |  notepad or string   | the notepad.        |
| tab         |  tab or string       | the tab.            |
</arguments>

This function selects a //tab// in a //notepad//.
</procedure>
</client>

== Style ==
<style>
This section describes the various CSS elements used to configure
//Notepads//.

=== ++div.hop-notepad-title++ ===
<css> div.hop-notepad-title 

This element specifies the graphical configuration of the title (the
++<NPHEAD>++ body) of the //Notepad//.
</css>

=== ++div.hop-notepad-body++ ===
<css> div.hop-notepad-body 

The overall body of the //Notepad//.
</css>

=== ++div.hop-notepad-tab++ ===
<css> div.hop-notepad-tab 

The box containing each tab body.
</css>

=== ++div.hop-notepad-tabs++ ===
<css> div.hop-notepad-tabs 

The horizontal box containing all tabs.
</css>

=== ++div.hop-notepad-tabs > span++ ===
<css> div.hop-notepad-tabs > span

The tab span. The active //tab// (i.e., the tab currently selected) is 
denoted by the ++hop-nptab-active++ class. The inactives //tabs// are denoted 
by the ++hop-nptab-inactive++ class.

</css>

=== ++hop-notepad.css++ ===

The file ++hop-notepad.css++ contains the default graphical configuration.
It is defined as:

,(<P>)
<share>hop-notepad.css</share>
</style>
